arts.ttl: Bologna’s Youth Revolution: The Secrets of a Club Building for Present and Future
arts.sum: Bologna are experiencing a youth revolution, with eleven players born in the 21st century forming the core of their present and future squad. This diverse group covers all positions on the field, from attacking wingers led by Ndoye to fullbacks, midfielders, strikers like Castro and Dallinga, and even a goalkeeper. arts.ttl: Bologna visit Lecce to keep battling for 4th place
arts.sum: Nikola Krstovic has been involved in five goals in his last four league games (3 goals, 2 assists), as many as in his previous 22 appearances in the competition (4 goals, 1 assist); the Lecce striker has netted seven goals in two different Serie A campaigns with the Giallorossi and, prior to him, the last player to achieve this with the Apulians was David Di Michele, between 2010-11 and 2011-12. Lecce have won two of their 15 home matches against Bologna in Serie A (D8 L5); among sides they have faced at least 15 times at home in the competition, only against Milan and Roma (6%) do they have a lower winning rate than against Bologna (13%).

arts.sum: Harry Maguire's late winner helped Manchester United beat Leicester City in the FA Cup on Friday and Ruben Amorim's side will now enjoy a few days off before their next game

arts.ttl: Ruben Amorim defends Patrick Dorgu decision after scathing Roy Keane review
arts.sum: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim defended his decision to play the club's new left-footed defender Patrick Dorgu at right wing-back, a tactical call which received a typically blunt appraisal from former Red Devils skipper Roy Keane. "They've brought new players in, you're thinking he's [Dorgu] going to play in his position and he's playing right wing-back.
